column1: You are really good at modesty. Shes a genius.  She painted this incredible mural in the kids room. Theres a hippo leading a parade of 500 childrenâ€”
Oh, yeah
Its sports marketing basically. But the athletes are partners.
In Philly, so, that doesnt really work for the family. Watch this guy make a billion dollars off my idea.
An Altima or better.
we good?
No, Pete is not the new Jim. The only we have in common is that neither of us wants to sit on Merediths face.  And if that  makes him the new Jim, then every human being in the world is the new Jim.
Done. Explain.
Oh, now I get what Pete was talking about at the sales meeting yesterday.
The new guys called one.
Clark ended the whole thing with a karate demonstration. Did you know there was a belt above black?
You should ask him. Its a color you would never expect.  Too easy.
You a sports fan?
Oh. Any team sports?
Phillies fan, though, right?
No, like baseball. A baseball team.
Ok. Good talk.
I have nothing in common with Plop.
Oh, come on, Pete! God, thats just sad. If he doesnt watch himself, hes gonna be here for years, doing nothing.  Wow, maybe Pete is the new Jim.
Yeah. You know what? Ill meet you down there. Just gotta make a quick call.
Hey, man. Its halpert. Did you go to the other guy yet? Great, dont. Im in. Yeah, yep, Im all in. Ok, talk to you soon. Bye.  Yeah!
Spinning would be more fun.

Pam, we gotta go. Cece, go back inside. Grandmas got breakfast, OK?  We are going to Roys wedding. Yep, Roy. I think the only weird thing about going to your wifes ex-fiancÃ©s wedding on a weekday at eight AM is that its your wifes ex-fiancÃ©.
A banana?
Oh, come on. Not even Roy will have hot dogs at his wedding.
Just so weird.
Is this his house?
OK.
Uh, my ex-fiancÃ©.

I started a new business with my college friend. But, Pam doesnt know. Um actually I did tell Pam and we decided â€˜no. But, then I decided yes anyway. So, Im thinking theres another conversation coming. And, its hard to know when that will be.
There he is. Is it almost time to cut the pancake, or what?
Thanks for inviting us, by the way-
That was, that was a surprise.
Youre welcome.
By the way, man, this place is... beautiful.
Gravel company?
Not gravel, obviously.  No, things are good. Things are good. Got some stuff in the works. So-
Yeah, you never know.
OK, Kenny.
He plays piano?
Definitely.
Courtside seats. Sixers.
It was an away game.
No.
Um, ok.

Oh, heres one. Did I ever tell you about the time that my brothers videotaped the lottery announcement? And bought the winning numbers the next day? And then, played the tape for me the next week, and I-
You heard that one.
That I thought we were millionaires.
Thats all right.
You all right?
Ready?
John Stamos.
Right. And did you show them the market? Yeah. And whatd they say? Thats awesome! That, oh my god! Wow!
Its not even real yet. And Im not gonna tell her til its real.
Im sorry. This is for a news audition?
I can feel you looking at me.
Uh-huh.
That didnt happen. You wouldve told me right away.
Uh...
God, give it up, Beesley. You know me too well.
Dont worry about it. I have a thing. A thing of soup. Which Ive been wanting to try.
That was really good, Darryl.
Andy, you gotta check this out. He just showed meâ€”.
I deserved that.
Uh, what happened to that video I sent you?
I think I got it right here.
You got it.

Last week, I finally told Pam about the other job I took in Philly...the side job. And she was so incredibly cool about it. And now I just wanna do something huge for her. Like if we were in some biker bar and she mouthed off to some bikers and they came lumbering over and I was like wham!  Gotta go through me first.
Getting my wife a week off from work.
Awesome, right?
Well, I dont know about the rest of you but Im just gonna say it. Im nervous. I have no idea what health problems this is all gonna cause.
â€œSide effects of EMF include headaches...â€
â€..breast pain...â€
Oof. â€œInfertility.â€
Ah! Theres my popcorn. Can you just grab that for me?
What?
Thats impossible, cause thats a brand new bag... Oh my god.
Im gonna drive you up to the lake, give you a whole week on the water. Just you, me and the kids.
You mean Lavernes Pies Tires Fixed Also?  Yes we will be doing that. Well be getting a dozen.
Why would you say that? I meant 4 apple, 4 blueberry, 2 cherry, 1 peach and 1 chocolate. I thought that was implied.
What?
What?
Alright, alright, gang. Lets just settle down. Youre yelling in her face.
Just...you good?
Im so sorry for all of this.
Ill get you a napkin. Someone get napkins please!
Pam, Im really sorry. I- Im really sorry about...all that.  Really? Smirking?
Hey, Dwight. I was trying to do something nice for Pam.  Can you just, help me out? Can we maybe take this thing somewhere? Or do something to not make this the worst day ever?
Andy!
Youre the boss. Dont you think wed all be a lot more productive if while we were doing work we looked up and saw the best rural pie stand in Pennsylvania?
What are you talking about? Youre not the boss. Andy is. Andy?
Next stop Lavernes Pies Tires Fixed Also.
So it looks like this work bus was a pretty good idea after all, huh?
You got it.
If by lately you mean the last twelve years, yeah.
Hes just mad that were all having fun.
Hes fine. Hes indestructible.
Lets go driver!  Laverne packs up the pie wagon at five so...
OK, well I saw a station about a mile back so, chop chop.
Are you kidding me? Dwight, come on!

Oh no, Im gonna push him. You know why? Because youre getting a pie. Why? Cause you deserve it. And what is he doing? Hes trying to drive us all around the countryside looking for gas because he knows we wont get there. Is that what we want?!
What do we want?!
When do we want it?!
Thats impossible.  Dwight!
What are you doing?
You know hes doing all this on purpose.
Dwight? Why are you such a jerk? I am trying to do something for my wife and you keep derailing-
What?
Is this about the popcorn? Or the X on the ceiling? Dwight, that was a prank.
No.
Ill take it.
Dwight, sometimes it takes couples years to get pregnant.
That doesnt matter.
Ok...thats not...
Did you ever think that because you own the building, everyone in it, were all kinda like your children?
Well, now you have a bus full of real..bilden..kin..
OK. And theyre all dangerously close to not getting pie. And theres only one guy who can save them. Its not me.
Its pretty good actually.
We bonded. We got to-
Dont..
Dont..
Pie! Pie! Pie!
We did it.
It wont budge.
Ceces really into princesses now. So we decided to turn them into a positive female role models.
Its Okay.
Sure I am. I am... one of the Men in Black guys.  Can I have your sunglasses?
Theres a big investment lunch today, so I decided to skip the costume.
Gettin a lot of mileage out of this, arent ya?
Are you sure youre okay with me putting in this much money.
Youre the best.
Okay. Ill see you in a little bit.
Shut up.
Wow.
Oh, uh, is it too late to get in?
Oh, I actually talked to my wife and wed really like to uh you know, invest - get in on the ground floor.
We were thinking somewhere between five - ten thousand? I can do the full ten thousand. We should just -  - all in.
All right.  Awesome. Cool.
Oh man, it was great. They were great.
I did, yeah.
Uh, man, by the end I guess it was about... ten...
Ten. It was the full ten.
Yeah.
Yeah. Yeah. Its a good thing we talked about it though, because we had to...
Yeah.
What is it?
Um, oh man, I dont actually know.
They werent really talking that much about money. They just said, Were good with investing and then I...and I...
No, no, I had to. Look, I needed to look like a team player, Pam.
You werent there.
It was very clear that ten thousand was what we had...we should talk about it later.
Pam.
Well talk about it later.
I thought that concert was pretty great.
Angela, its Halloween. You have to sing â€˜Monster Mash.
Uh...
Okay. Well, just forget it.
Because it is Halloween. So if youre going to sing a concert, its a good idea to throw that one in.
And his brother, Walt Jr., locked himself in the wine cellar.
Competent.
Dwight!
No, you chose yourself.
Yes. He is. And you know what? We cannot let that happen.
See these forms...
What the heck is going on?! The stock prices are plummeting! Are you gonna take control of the message or do I have to send in someone who understands the media?!
Good afternoon!
Uh, this Wallace guy is lookin at hard time. And we only know this because of what Dwight Snoot said on record!
Hi, David.
Go ahead David, Im listening.
I cant. I have the thing.
I have this conference call today with this company in Philly that Im helping start. Ah, first board meeting. Also, the first time Ive ever been excited about work. So, that feels... wrong.
Yeah, Im here. Are we all on?
Right. Okay, uh, over the next three months...
I uh, I have some ideas, actually...
Uh yeah. Trust me, Id rather be with you guys.
Oh,  Sorry, I uh... was just saying that we should uh...
Um, you know what?  I.. should have just had... I should have just had you call me on my cell.
Im gonna try a different spot. Okay?
Okay, Ill call you right back.
What I was saying is the genius of Air Jordan was not in the market saturation, it was in --
The... the... the... what I was saying is the real genius was... was in the...
It was, uh in the authentic design, right? So I mean, you really felt like Michael Jordan was wearing these shoes, so ...
Nobody!
No, no, no.
Jim Halpert.
Hey man. I am so sorry about that.
Yeah. No, I know. This whole telecommuting thing -- not ideal. But dont worry. Ill figure it out.
Uh, what does -- what does that mean?
You got this, Beesley. Actually, do you want me to come down and help you get started?
What? Yeah, right. As if.
Today I will be asking David Wallace if I can start working part-time, because the sports marketing company that I started really needs me to be there.
I could have prevented that. So I have to talk to Wallace.
Hey David, how would you like a guy whos not here as much, gets paid the same amount of salary, and has bigger fish to fry in Philadelphia?
This is gonna be awful.
I mean, I can handle any client issues from Philly.
Oh, you mean handle it in person. Oh, well, Phyllis and Stanley have agree to cover for me while Im gone.
Yep.
Oh, great.
Because were friends.
Unfair. Whens my birthday?
How about this-- You let me take you to lunch, and I make my case?
All right.
You know, truth be told, I think all youll really be doing is accepting calls from my clients while Im gone.
You know, at the end of the day, its really only two days. I mean, Ill be back in the office. Â If you need me for an emergency, call me. Â Ill be there...
Tell me about it.
All right. You know what? Â Maybe well just... Well go slow.
Listen, I was really wondering if maybe we could lock this down before lunch is over.
All right. Phyllis! Phyllis, thats-- thats decorative.
Still decorative.
No.
Dont-- dont-- dont pole people with knives.
Phyllis! Â Wow.
Well, were here. Perfect. Â
Phyllis, what was that?Phyllis are you dreaming, or--
This is hilarious, but were gonna stop with all--
Shuckin the peas. Â You should go back to the first part, though. You are Â gonna Â cover for me?
Oh, my God, thank you.  Thank you.
Im having second thoughts about one of the shirts I packed. The blue one with the stripes.
Well, yeah, but Im wondering if its too blue. Like, am I making a statement with the blueness?

I am leaving early today for Philly, because tomorrow is the first day of my new job. So I figure Id get in at 500, check into a hotel at about 600 so I can get a real good night of restless sleep and nervous puking.
So you know my job has something to do with sports, but you dont know the end of the word "Philadelphia"?
Yes! That, that, that! Were definitely doing that. Are we all in agreement?
Done, right?
Im not understanding the confusion. Am I the only one who wants to try hufflepuffs and schnauzerhosen, and meet this glenpickle guy?
Right.
Were thinking of collaborating with Mike Schmidt on some of his charity work.
Whoo!
Yeah, I think so.
Uh--
Best Christmas ever.
Thank you.
Cant wait.
I dont know. Is it what you expected?
So happy right now.
Yes, he is finally nigh.
So hes kind of like santa, except dirty and worse.
Wow! Its my favorite part of Christmas. The authority.
Oh, its like naughty or nice.
Quick question--Do you just decide who gets what in the moment, or did you make a list?
Oh, nice. Did you check that list?
But more than once? cause you could have made a mistake.
Okay, so you made a list, you checked it twice, and now youre gonna find out whos--
Damn.
Ooh.
Oh...what was that? Now Im gonna be all whipped for my first day at work. God.  One second. Oh...
Im probably never gonna see you again.
Okay, sorry, sorry.
Listen, thank you so much for putting that all together. That was the perfect last Christmas party. All right, wish me luck.
Ill call you when I get in.
All right.
Love you.
I think theyre going to the conference finals.
Bynum, obvious monster and the three point shooting, dont even-...
I bit my lip at lunch today.
Now I have this big bump in my lip that hurts. I hate it.
Okay, you need to think about it before you come with the...
Whatever. Its not a big deal. You know I always tell my three year old, if this is the worst thing thats gonna happen... You gotta be kidding me! Ok! Pam! Thats it, Im going home!

I am meeting Dr. J today, otherwise known as Julius Irving, famed 76er and my own personal hero. But i have to be careful not to rub it in Pams face because lets be honest, how would I feel if I was at home stuck with the kids while she was go carting with John Stamos.
You sound tired. Everything ok?
Uhh, a little bit. Its a lot of pressure, you know, but thats what I signed up for right?
Uh, you know what, I gotta hop off because my, uh, taxi is here to take me to the meeting.
Ok
Thanks!
Love you too. Bye.
Oh man, thats fresh squeezed. And, uh are all the snacks complimentary?
Oh no, no, no. Thats ok.  Um Im sorry, is this the conference center?
You gotta be kidding me.
Are you kidding me? I can literally scalp tickets to this.
Listen, I dont mean to intimidate you, but I did play a little high school ball.
Alright.  Oh, sorry. Im so sorry. Its my wife, can I take this?
Right!  Hey, whats up? Everything ok?
Its still happening right now actually, so uh...
Yes, it is very stressful. You sure everythings okay?
Okay, bye.  So sorry about that.
I love it.
Okay, Im Kareem. That makes total sense. Im Kareem. Youre Dr. J. Just sounds weird to say out loud.
And thats all?
No one will believe this back home, but thats okay. Let me show you how its done.
This is Jim Halpert, leave a message.
Sorry, Stinky, cant do it. Too busy.
Okay. Theres no possible way I can get there, so just ask Phyllis. She can be your older sister or something.
Hey, Im in Philadelphia right now.
Huh. How long would it take me if I drove 300 miles an hour?
No, I hear what youre saying, and we will. The thing is, we gotta lock down this key demographic first. The rest will come, I promise. Just give me a couple weeks, alright?
Weeks. Always weeks. Man, the last time I talked months was like, a million weeks ago.
Thanks Dennis, I appreciate it.  Hey! How are you?
What are you doing here?
Thats so great!
Its pretty great, right? I mean, were coming along  Hey, Wade, we gotta just push up Denniss timeline
Actually, you know what? Give me one second, okay? Make yourselves at home.
Well, I mean, I dont even have the paycheck yet. It is a startup, so These things go down all the time.
Are you cool to just hang out?
Yeah?  You ready?
Lets do it!
Mm-hm
And as you know, I was a paper salesman.  Hey, I find it helps if you just picture everybody naked.
Okay, so the consensus was that that was unique. Theyre going to make you pay for the fish, and they wanted to know when you can start.
I think Im a little too busy these days to s---  Oh ,my God. I did send Dwight on a quest for the Holy Grail.
The Dunder Code! I completely forgot about that prank. That had to be like six or seven years ago. Stayed late every night for a month. Had a lot more free time back then.
Man, I wish I was there to see his face when he gets to the end ...
...and finds the... fake grail? No grail?
I dont.
Oh, I expected more from young Halpert.
Hey.
Okay. Can we keep it on the early side, though? I got that thing in Scranton later.
Ceces ballet recital is today. I cannot wait. Ive been working with her on her move. Its called the Cece Spin and Kiss. Do you want to see it? Its kind of like this. Its pretty cute, right?
Well, take your worst fear and multiply it by infinity.
Yeah. Even you.
Bye, Dwight.
Hi. How are ya? Good to see you.
Hey. I was just about to call you.
I am still in Philly, actually.
Its insane. This huge investor got cold feet, so Im stuck here trying to keep him on board.
Pam, I couldnt get out. I barely made it out just to make this phone call.
Youre gonna do great. And you know what? Mommys gonna record it. So well watch it together. Do you mind doing that, Pam?
Okay. Are you sure you know how to do video on the phone?
Okay, okay, you know, just sometimes youre not the best with the phone.
Bye. Â  Yep. See, youve still got to press â€œEnd,â€ Pam.
Uh, Wade actually has those on the road, but hes gonna be calling in with those numbers any second. So just hold on one s--
Oh, actually... uh, nope. That is my wife. Again, hell be calling in any second.
Hey.
We lost Bridgeport Capital. I have no idea what happened. Its like everything I did, he just wouldnt go for it.
I have no idea where were gonna come up with this money, and we have to work insanely hard over the next few weeks.
Can you figure out how to upload Ceces dance recital? I definitely could use a pick-me-up.
Youre not serious, are you? You didnt get any of the recital?
Come on, Pam. Pam, I asked you if you could use the phone, and you swore that you knew how.
Oh, great. So well see somebody elses kid with Cece in the background? I mean, its really not that hard to film a video.
Look, Pam, I dont know what to tell you. I mean, what do I do? Its gone. That moments just gone. I missed it.
Youre not serious, right? I mean, how is that fair? Im in Philly. These are my days in Philly. Youve agreed to this.
Pam, Im not explaining this to you-- Pam, Im not going over this again.
I dont know how else to tell you, okay? Im doing everything I can every week to bring home something...
Im doing this just for me? Is that what Im doing? Im doing it just for me. If thats what you think, then this is a really sad night. But you know what? I got to go. Okay?
Well talk tomorrow?
Okay. Ill talk to you tomorrow.
You couldve just called that an alliance too, right?
Things are a little delicate with me and Pam right now. And if my working in Philly is gonna end up doubling the Dwight in her life, thats only gonna make things worse.
Im talking to him this afternoon, but dont get your hopes up.

Last week, my company in Philly lost a big investor, so were scrambling to find new funding. Luckily, my partners have a fix â€“ me asking the boss of the company Im abandoning to give us a gigantic influx of cash.  So problem solved. Thanks, guys.
Im on the phone. Im on the phone.
Im just gonna call you back. Thanks.
Im sure hes just nervous.
Sure, yeah, go ahead.
Yeah, absolutely.  Do people like sitting next to you? Youre clean, right?
Nice. Music. Do you listen to it in earbuds? You dont listen to it at all because were at work, not a Florence and the Machine concert, soâ€”
Sure, yeah. Do whatever you need to do.
Right after you do one thing for me. I need you to breathe in my face.
I need you to breathe in my face right now.
What are we working with, peppermint or wintergreen?
I knew it, I knew it.
I looked at you coming around, and I said, â€œWintergreen.â€
How is it my fault?
But its Dwight whos bring in all the weirdos.
Yeah, this is actually about the new sales guy. Uh, Dwight has brought in a bunch of real weirdos. And I was wondering if I could have some inputâ€”
I was just thinking that because this person is gonna be sitting at my desk, near my wifeâ€”
Oh. Um
Okay. I cant say that thats not fair.
Oh, yeah, so well just do that later.
Uh  Well, its about Athlead. Im sorry. Does Dwight have to be on this part of the phone call?
Theres a very exciting opportunity to be a core investor â€“
Yes, okay. Bye.
No, thanks.
Dwight, you cant just hire someone â€˜cause theyre your friend.
Ahh, I love staring off in one direction. If Im not looking south, Im not livin.  Thats what I always say.
But you know I wouldnt hire any of these all-stars.
Nope. Your friends not turning out to be as great as you thought? Not even Gabor?
I knew it. You designed a uniform for Dunder Mifflin.
Well, I for one, was amazed at how qualified everyone was. You?
And I gotta say, this was a tough decision. And we had to go with none of you.
Well, you know, Wallace put me in charge, so you have no say.
Too much now.
That seems inconsiderate.
All right. I think that went well.
So, uh, if you just take a look at this, and then thatll print outâ€”Hey. Meet your new desk mate.
Trust me, this is the least of all evils. It took me all day to pull this off, so you should be thrilled, considering.
Okay. Im really sorry I told the guys Id be there for the board meeting.
Ill call you when I get there.
All right.
Take care of my wife. I will be back.

No, it does matter who ends up sitting next to Pam when Im gone. The people around you are basically who you end up spending your life with. I mean, because of where my desk was, I spent all those years looking at Pam, and I fell in love. So, that stuff matters. Definitely does.
You couldve just called that an alliance too, right?
Things are a little delicate with me and Pam right now. And if my working in Philly is gonna end up doubling the Dwight in her life, thats only gonna make things worse.
Im talking to him this afternoon, but dont get your hopes up.

Im on the phone. Im on the phone.
Im just gonna call you back. Thanks.
Im sure hes just nervous.
Sure, yeah, go ahead.
Yeah, absolutely.  Do people like sitting next to you? Youre clean, right?
Nice. Music. Do you listen to it in earbuds? You dont listen to it at all because were at work, not a Florence and the Machine concert, soâ€”
Sure, yeah. Do whatever you need to do.
Right after you do one thing for me. I need you to breathe in my face.
I need you to breathe in my face right now.
What are we working with, peppermint or wintergreen?
I knew it, I knew it.
I looked at you coming around, and I said, â€œWintergreen.â€
How is it my fault?
But its Dwight whos bring in all the weirdos.
Yeah, this is actually about the new sales guy. Uh, Dwight has brought in a bunch of real weirdos. And I was wondering if I could have some inputâ€”
I was just thinking that because this person is gonna be sitting at my desk, near my wifeâ€”
Oh. Um
Okay. I cant say that thats not fair.
Oh, yeah, so well just do that later.
Uh  Well, its about Athlead. Im sorry. Does Dwight have to be on this part of the phone call?
Theres a very exciting opportunity to be a core investor â€“
Yes, okay. Bye.
No, thanks.
Dwight, you cant just hire someone â€˜cause theyre your friend.
Ahh, I love staring off in one direction. If Im not looking south, Im not livin.  Thats what I always say.
But you know I wouldnt hire any of these all-stars.
Nope. Your friends not turning out to be as great as you thought? Not even Gabor?
I knew it. You designed a uniform for Dunder Mifflin.
Well, I for one, was amazed at how qualified everyone was. You?
And I gotta say, this was a tough decision. And we had to go with none of you.
Well, you know, Wallace put me in charge, so you have no say.
Too much now.
That seems inconsiderate.
All right. I think that went well.
So, uh, if you just take a look at this, and then thatll print outâ€”Hey. Meet your new desk mate.
Trust me, this is the least of all evils. It took me all day to pull this off, so you should be thrilled, considering.
Okay. Im really sorry I told the guys Id be there for the board meeting.
Ill call you when I get there.
All right.
Take care of my wife. I will be back.

No, it does matter who ends up sitting next to Pam when Im gone. The people around you are basically who you end up spending your life with. I mean, because of where my desk was, I spent all those years looking at Pam, and I fell in love. So, that stuff matters. Definitely does.
Hey.
We are splitting a sublet on a place near Philly.
And, as much as I miss Pam and the kids, its, uh, kinda nice to live the bachelor life again. You know, let your hair down.
Im couching it!
And this dude labels his food. Hes the clean one. And, Im the messy one. How much fun is this?
Hey. So, Wade wants to send people to the Sloan conference. We gotta compile a list of our target clients.
Who is this guy? We are killing it.
Yeah!
Nice job, man.
What?  Oh, man! Im sorry about that.
Oh, um... Are you really mad about this?
Oh. Its your go-to therm. Oh, man. Thats a bummer. Im sorry about that.
No, no. If its a big deal, its a big deal.
No big deal.
Honestly, I dont mind.  Did you want me to wash it for you or...
OK. Here ya go.
Hey.
Yeah. Totally.
Its mine. Dont worry.
I dont think you had to.
I think you might be going a little crazy with this labeling thing, man. I mean, you put your name on a five pound bag of flour. Are you honestly saying that if I needed flour I couldnt use that?
Thats not the point.
No, Im not making bread.
Darryl, it doesnt matter. I think you know the point Im trying to make.
Its all good. Are we all good?
Whats that cooler?
Oh, crap. Were those yours?

Wow. This whole Philly thing has been so much fun that I may have lost sight of what really matters. I mean, having fun is not nearly as important as being good to the people who you really care about. I mean, thats just Roommates 101.
Oh. Oh!
You win.  How good did that feel?
Its like magic. Or, its like me getting on my hands and knees and begging my partners to switch a Tuesday for a Thursday.
By the way, they do need an extra day next week.
They are terrible.
Oh my god. Thats so romantic.
Oh my god. Thats less romantic.
Yeah, yeah. No, totally. Thats good. So, should we just get a bottle of wine later and celebrate?

Im very excited to see Brian. Brians a great guy. And Pam and I have gotten really close to he and his wife, Alyssa over the years. And he got fired for protecting my wife from a jerk in the warehouse. Im sorry, but you know him. Hes a good guy.
Hey, Brian.
What?
Oh.
Are you kidding? Thank you, man. I mean, Ive wanted the opportunity to say thanks for... everything. And Im really sorry about the job. That just seems crazy.
Well, I mean, thats OK. It doesnt mean that its over. Right? I mean, couples fight.
What?
Crying?
